title: Coronation Street spoilers: Josh is stabbed during prison riot tonight
text:
David Platt’s (Jack P Shepherd) prison sentence went from bad to worse in Coronation Street when rapist Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton) showed up during the latest episode. However, matters are set to get much worse tonight, as a prison riot breaks out —and Josh is stabbed amid the chaos. The question is: did David have anything to do with it?

After setting his sights upon Josh down at the medical wing, David opened up to Abe about how he’d been raped by Josh.

Afterwards, Abe encouraged David to seek revenge on his rapist during the prison riot which was set to ensue the following day. David thought about it, but he ultimately wasn’t sure what to do for the best.

During tonight’s episode, the riot breaks out and, as a result, David decides to retreat to his cell in order to avoid getting into trouble. However, Abe brings the trouble directly to him, as he drags Josh into his cell, before handing David a pair of scissors and telling him to do whatever he wants to his rapist. After giving it some thought, David tells Abe he’d rather deal with Josh alone.

Later, the Platt family are horrified to hear about the riot via the news, and Shona (Julia Goulding) receives a call from David — who informs her that Josh has been stabbed.

What’s more, he tells her to urgently find him a lawyer.

Did David exact revenge on his rapist?

Or did Josh simply get caught up in the prison riot?

Coronation Street continues Monday 21st October at 7:30pm and 8:30pm.

description: David's given an opportunity to seek revenge on his rapist tonight — but will he go through with it?
